58 hic incipit uita sancti Siluestri.
SEint Silue&slong;tre Seint Siluestre pope was &punctelev; þe fur&slong;te þat þare cam
þat euere hadde Rome in pes &punctelev; to holde up cristindom
For alle þat comen bi-fore him &punctelev; luþere Men to-drowe
And harleden heom out of þe londe &punctelev; and with tormens manie huy slowe
Ake ore louerdes mi&yogh;hte euere wax &punctelev; and þe strencþe of cristindom
So þat it was in betere pays &punctelev; þo seint siluestre cam
¶ It bi-fel þat he prechede þe Aumperoure &punctelev; Costantin þat was þo
þat he grauntede him þe churche of Rome &punctelev; in pays with-outen wo
Ake erore he hadde wo i-nou&yogh;h &punctelev; are it mi&yogh;hte þar to astonde
For in prisone he was ofte ido &punctelev; and ofte idriue out of londe
¶ A luþur Iustise cam in a time &punctelev; into þe contreye aboute
For-to tormenti cristine men &punctelev; and to[overlined.] harli with gret route
he liet martri ane holie Man &punctelev; þat hiet thymothe
And liet him sethþe in a foul stude &punctelev; casten with gret vilte
Seint siluestre wente a-ni&yogh;ht &punctelev; and þat bodi þannes drou&yogh;h
And burede it with gret honour &punctelev; in a fair place inou&yogh;h
¶ þe Iustise sethþe it vnder-&yogh;at &punctelev; siluestre faste he nam
And seide, "þeof, þou schalt habbe &punctelev; þat ilke sulue dom
&YOGH;wy laddest þou a-wei þanne þeof trichour &punctelev; &yogh;wodere hastþou him ibrou&yogh;t
Certes sire quath siluestre &punctelev; þeof ne trichour nas he nou&yogh;ht
Ake þou art swuch on, ich wot it wel &punctelev; and godes martyr he is
And þat þou þare-of þe soþe iseo &punctelev; to-ni&yogh;ht þou schalt iwis
In strongue deþe astrangled &punctelev; and wiende to þe pine of helle
"A, þeof traitour," quath þe Iustise &punctelev; raþer ichulle þe a-quelle
¶ He liet nime þis holie man &punctelev; and in strong prisone caste
For-to he bi-sei&yogh;e him in &yogh;wat deþe &punctelev; he were i-brou&yogh;t ate laste
his soper he liet greiþi faire &punctelev; ase he was iwoned to do
And with grete pruyte and noblei&yogh;e &punctelev; he eode and sat þar-to
A fisches bon schet in is þrote &punctelev; ase he sat and·et· and ·et·
þat neuereft ne cam out a-&yogh;ein : are he is lijf fur-liet;
For he was a-choked a-non : and toward þe deþe he drou&yogh;h,
Vnneþe he liuede for-to mid-ni&yogh;ht : with pine and seoruwe i-nov.
¶ His Men þat weren is conseilers : comen eorninde faste
Into þe prisone to siluestre : and sore huy weren a-gaste,
And seiden, "leoue louerd, fur-&yogh;if us : þat we þe habbez mis-do!
Gret wreche to ore Maister cam for þe : ne lat nou&yogh;ht to us so!
Louerd, graunte us þi guode wille : we nelleth mis-don þe non-more;
Go forth &yogh;ware þi wille is : we biddeth þe milce and ore."
¶ þis guode man wende out of prison : with honour i-nov&yogh;,
Ri&yogh;ht ase Men þane luþere Iustise : to-ward þe eorþe drov&yogh;.
þat folk bi-leueden heore owene prince : þat huy heolden er so hei&yogh;e,
And alle siweden þis holi man : for miracle þat huy seien.
Sorie weren þe luþere Men þo : for heore lawe eode al-to nau&yogh;hte;
And þe cristine Men weren glade i-nou&yogh; : for al þe pris huy cau&yogh;hte.
Mani heþene Man þare-fore : tornede to cristindom,
And wel þe betere pais þoru&yogh; al þe lond : a-mong cristine men bi-cam.
¶ Seint siluestre bi-lefde pope : in guod pais þo i-nov&yogh;
And muche folk wide a-boute : to godes lawe þare drou&yogh;.
Preostes he made and deknene al-so : and he him-sulf furst bi-founde
þe ordres to maken a-&yogh;ein midewynter : þat men halt &yogh;uy[t] in al þe londe.
Al-so he bi-fond þat Men scholden : maken þe seruise
with linnene cloth clene i-wasche : ope þe weuede in alle wise,
And helie with clene linnene cloth : ore louerdes flechs and is blod,
And noþer in pal ne in seolke : nere it no so guod—
¶ And þat was, for, þo ore louerd : bou&yogh;te us with is blode,
Iosep of Aramathie : nam him a-doun of þe rode
And wond him in &yogh;wi&yogh;ht linnene cloth : ase þe godspel hath i-seid,
Ake noþur in seolke ne in sendel : þo þat swete flesch was ded.
In swuch cloth ase is swete flechs : was i-wounde þo,
his swete flechs schal ope þe weued : beon i-wounden euere-mo.
þis guode Man þreo-and-twenti &yogh;er : pope was at rome
And þreo monþes and endleoue dawes : are is ende-day him come.
And þo he deide in godes seruise : ase he hadde longue þare-in i-beo,
I-bured he was bi-side rome : for-soþe, Milene þreo.
Nou god for is swete loue : us graunti þulke blisse
þat seint siluestre is inne : þat we þar-of ne misse.
